item.title: Lobsters Top Stories: Tuesday, March 4, 2025 at 1:25 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Use Firefox in 2025 (46 points | 36 comments)
2. TigerBeetle Architecture (8 points | 2 comments)
3. Do not run any Cargo commands on untrusted projects (15 points | 10 comments)
4. Apple's Software Quality Crisis: When Premium Hardware Meets Subpar Software (84 points | 91 comments)
5. VT220 font emulation in browser (17 points | 9 comments)
6. Mozilla updates Firefox's Terms again after backlash (5 points | 4 comments)
7. Why Can’t We Screenshot Frames From DRM-Protected Video on Apple Devices? (34 points | 16 comments)
8. Making Flow – Interview with director Gints Zilbalodis — (13 points | 1 comment)
9. Some things that make Rust lifetimes hard to learn (26 points | 17 comments)
10. You Need Much Less Memory than Time (13 points | 4 comments)
11. The Fibrovisor: Turning a dollar store fibre optic wand into a low resolution display (21 points | no comments)
12. How fast can you open 1000 files? (23 points | 13 comments)
13. DuckDB goes distributed? DeepSeek’s smallpond takes on Big Data (4 points | 1 comment)
14. The power of interning: making a time series database 2000x smaller in Rust (15 points | 1 comment)
15. smallpond: A lightweight data processing framework built on DuckDB and 3FS (5 points | no comments)
16. Avoid the nightmare bicycle (3 points | 1 comment)
17. globstar — open-source static analysis toolkit for writing code checkers in YAML and GO (6 points | 1 comment)
18. The Botfly Test: Characterizing parasitic automated behavior in online communities (14 points | 3 comments)
19. Tangled — a git collaboration platform built on atproto (54 points | 20 comments)
20. illuminant - ActivityPub server with NNTP interface (32 points | 7 comments)
21. When declarative systems break (4 points | 2 comments)
22. HATETRIS - Obsession, Friendship, and World Records (13 points | 2 comments)
23. Hacking the Xbox 360 Hypervisor Part 1: System Overview (4 points | no comments)
24. A float walks into a gradual type system (15 points | 5 comments)
25. A case for feminism in programming language design (4 points | 2 comments)
